LayoutNode.Content: ALLERGY 6 Tips To Allergy-Proof Your Home For Spring March 19 2018 03:30 PM EDT weather.com
LayoutNode.SRC:
Allergy

6 Tips To Allergy-Proof Your Home For Spring

March 19 2018 03:30 PM EDT

weather.com
(Thinkstock)

LayoutNode.Content: sneezing and red, itchy eyes could take hold at any moment. But indoors, the real battle awaits.
LayoutNode.SRC: sneezing and red, itchy eyes could take hold at any moment. But indoors, the real battle awaits.

LayoutNode.Content: Inside the home are more areas of risk than you may think. But you can fight back, because a low-allergen home is a happy home.
LayoutNode.SRC: Inside the home are more areas of risk than you may think. But you can fight back, because a low-allergen home is a happy home.

LayoutNode.Content: Here are our small tips for keeping allergens at bay in your humble abode this spring.
LayoutNode.SRC: Here are our small tips for keeping allergens at bay in your humble abode this spring.
1. Get Rid Of Clutter

LayoutNode.Content: According to the Mayo Clinic, consolidating items that collect dust, like knick-knacks, ornaments, books and magazines can do wonders for your allergies. Also, if youâ€™re due for a new sofa, go leather, or a material that doesnâ€™t collect dust like upholstery.
LayoutNode.SRC: According to the Mayo Clinic, consolidating items that collect dust, like knick-knacks, ornaments, books and magazines can do wonders for yourallergies. Also, if youâ€™re due for a new sofa, go leather, or a material that doesnâ€™t collect dust like upholstery.
2. Stop Hang Drying Laundry Outside

LayoutNode.Content: will stick to clothing and especially sheets and towels while they dry. And theyâ€™ll stick well since wetness is a natural adhesive. Instead of leading to a situation where drying off after a shower leads to an instant sneezing fit, dry your clothes indoors. And if youâ€™re considering wearing items sitting in storage all winter, give them a wash too -- dust and mold could have built up on them.
LayoutNode.SRC: will stick to clothing and especially sheets and towels while they dry. And theyâ€™ll stick well since wetness is a natural adhesive. Instead of leadingto a situation where drying off after a shower leads to an instant sneezing fit, dry your clothes indoors. And if youâ€™re considering wearing itemssitting in storage all winter, give them a wash too -- dust and mold could have built up on them.
3. Get Those Carpets Cleaned

LayoutNode.Content: for flooring is a big ask, getting your carpets professionally cleaned once every spring will be a big help. Vacuuming them yourselves is a help, but it will not fully get rid of all lingering dust mites, while a professional can.
LayoutNode.SRC: for flooring is a big ask, getting your carpets professionally cleaned once every spring will be a big help. Vacuuming them yourselves is a help,but it will not fully get rid of all lingering dust mites, while a professional can.
4. Prepare Your A/C

LayoutNode.Content: dust out of it. If needed, get your air conditioner serviced professionally and install a filter with an American Society of Heating and Air-Conditioning Engineers MERV (Minimum Efficiency Reporting Value) rating of at least 8. That means fewer dust particles can pass through it. Once thatâ€™s ready to go, rely on it instead of opening windows, allowing pollen to enter.
LayoutNode.SRC: dust out of it. If needed, get your air conditioner serviced professionally and install a filter with an American Society of Heating andAir-Conditioning Engineers MERV (Minimum Efficiency Reporting Value) rating of at least 8. That means fewer dust particles can pass through it.Once thatâ€™s ready to go, rely on it instead of opening windows, allowing pollen to enter.
5. Get a HEPA Filter

LayoutNode.Content: And speaking of air purification, a HEPA (High Energy Particulate Air) filter can remove 99.97% of dust, pollen, smoke, odor, mold spores, and petdander in the air. They are discrete, inexpensive and can lead to a healthier home environment.
LayoutNode.SRC: And speaking of air purification, a HEPA (High Energy Particulate Air) filter can remove 99.97% of dust, pollen, smoke, odor, mold spores, and pet dander in the air. They are discrete, inexpensive and can lead to a healthier home environment.

LayoutNode.Content: 6. Donâ€™t Forget The Kitchen and Bathroom
LayoutNode.SRC: 6. Donâ€™t Forget The Kitchen and Bathroom

LayoutNode.Content: moisture and potential mold breeding grounds. This rings especially true in the warmer months, as mold grows faster in warm weather. And wipe hard-to-reach surfaces for dust too.
LayoutNode.SRC: moisture and potential mold breeding grounds. This rings especially true in the warmer months, as mold grows faster in warm weather. Andwipe hard-to-reach surfaces for dust too.
